column4: So I'm going to install Ubuntu on a machine, but I probably will rarely if ever see it again; it will be used just for basic productivity/web/etc. I'm more familiar with kubuntu, but should I go Ubuntu on it? (is ubuntu more independent than kubuntu?)
kubuntu just uses a different desktop environment than ubuntu, if it';s just going to be a headless server, ubuntu will be fine :)
it will be a desktop thing. I realize the difference between them ;)
then base it on which one you prefer to use, because kubuntu and ubuntu are basically the same thing
